pull.title: travis: Explicitly set --with-valgrind
pull.body:
Also remove CPPFLAGS=-DVALGRIND because that's redundant with when
configured with --enable-valgrind.

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

events.body: Nit: I think it would be better to rename `VALGRIND` in a separate commit

rename.from: travis: Explicitly set --enable-valgrind and disable once

events.message:
travis: Explicitly set --with-valgrind

Also set --with-valgrind=no once

travis: VALGRIND->RUN_VALGRIND to avoid confusion with WITH_VALGRIND

Also remove CPPFLAGS=-DVALGRIND because that's redundant when
configured with --with-valgrind.

events.body: ACK 4eecb4d6ef6d4f18be8870a5929feb1dae376d15 diff and travis output look good

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,7 +17,7 @@ compiler:
   - gcc
 env:
   global:
-    - WIDEMUL=auto  BIGNUM=auto  ENDOMORPHISM=no  STATICPRECOMPUTATION=yes  ECMULTGENPRECISION=auto  ASM=no  BUILD=check  EXTRAFLAGS=  HOST=  ECDH=no  RECOVERY=no SCHNORRSIG=no EXPERIMENTAL=no CTIMETEST=yes BENCH=yes ITERS=2
+    - WIDEMUL=auto  BIGNUM=auto  ENDOMORPHISM=no  STATICPRECOMPUTATION=yes  ECMULTGENPRECISION=auto  ASM=no  BUILD=check  ENABLE_VALGRIND=yes RUN_VALGRIND=no EXTRAFLAGS=  HOST=  ECDH=no  RECOVERY=no SCHNORRSIG=no EXPERIMENTAL=no CTIMETEST=yes BENCH=yes ITERS=2
comments.body: Should it run valgrind to be sure it worked?
